title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: I don't want to id the exact position/department because it would be too obvious. However, I thought better of Uconn before this. After 3 interviews, nobody had the courtesy to say "no thanks." They just ghosted. Very professional. Also, don't pressure your applicant to make up an answer. If somebody says they don't know, leave it at that.
Interview Questions: How heavy my workload was.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Thought out questions and very nice interviewers. asked about previous experience and desire to learn and expand in the field of engineering and or science development. interview was done over zoom and phone interview
Interview Questions: previous experience and education background

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Statement of Purpose is the main 'interview' component and requires your to encapsulate your purpose of going to grad school and what you have accomplished before coming to UConn and the school you are applying to for graduate work and research.
Interview Questions: What research do you want to work on?

title: Athletics Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Very good and welcoming, made me excited to work there. Knew I had a passion for sports and wanted to help out in any way possible. Could tell the interviewer was passionate about their job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UConn Athletics?

title: Student Athlete Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Online interview. They send me an email for an online meeting. During the meeting, they asked me if I had any previous experience assisting students with disabilities, which courses I would be able to tutor, and what my schedules were. The interview was efficient and respectful.
Interview Questions: Online interview. They asked me if I had any previous experience assisting students with disabilities, which courses I would be able to tutor, and what my schedules were. The interview was efficient and respectful.

title: Portfolio Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: In-person and write about the past experience essay, and then 5 panels would interview. Finally, they would decide whether to hire. Maybe would have an another talk. And also they will have a quick chat
Interview Questions: Talk about yourself and how was your last job

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Took over month after applications closed to interview. First was an online group interview with direct supervisor, a business person and a faculty member. Next interview was in person and a series of several interviews. Questions were repetitive, but it was good to see many of the people involved in the program.
Interview Questions: Pretty typical questions. One that did throw me was, "why a masters in x topic." Never had employers care before about the topic of my Masters l, but given the nature of the role I guess it makes sense.

title: Nursing Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Uconn is my dream place to work. Innovative research, groundbreaking technology and community as well as support system. Very inspiring place to want to work. I am pleased to have an interview lined up.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Made it through first interview only, had a small panel of relevant team members attend. Everyone was pleasant but it seemed a bit disorganized. It was hard to get a good sense of the team
Interview Questions: 5 questions asked in total

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews FOR STUDENTS WHO ARE PLANNING TO WORK IN STUDENT ACTIVITIES, not sure what the process is for full time university employees I was only a student worker for them
Interview Questions: How was your day today?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. Zoom call and then offered position next day. The interviewer was super friendly and got to know me. Answered all my questions and made sure I knew what would be expected of me.
Interview Questions: What days are you available?

title: Group Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviews that were simple and fun. first round is student interviews so they are really relaxed, the last round is a physical audition but there is a large focus on personality and attitude
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: First interview was online, second was in person. Rejected by email by HR.  Panel interviews for both with a list of questions that people took turns asking. No real chance to ask meaningful questions or have a real back and forth.
Interview Questions: What is  your biggest weakness?

title: Educational Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was scheduled shortly after the application was closed through the portal. I was contacted to do a group interview with several stakeholders within the department. Everyone I connected with during this virtual interview was professional, kind and presumably enjoyed the work they do at UConn. Ultimately I withdrew my application due to salary requirements, but otherwise would have continued through the process after being selected as a finalist. Again, wonderful group of people, just not the right role for me.
Interview Questions: General tell me about yourself and interest in this role, or tell me about a time when questions. Relatively simple and flowed nicely.

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and interesting. The managers of the office were very kind and informative about the job and answered all my questions. I was offered the job and happily accepted. The scheduling was very quick, and the process was seem less from inquriy to offer acceptance.
Interview Questions: The questions were standard of an interview.

title: Student Instructional Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: It was virtual and it was a comfortable space. It lasted half an hour and there were less than ten questions that mostly focused on why I wanted the job, qualifications, and prior leadership experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position? Tell me about two experiences that make you qualified for this position? How are you with keeping up with secretarial work like taking attendance and posting on the website? What does being a role model mean to you?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Interesting. Was really hard to find Facilities building when interviewing. Campus is huge. Moderate interview, they didn't ask any "gotcha" questions. Overall, don't think job was a good fit for me
Interview Questions: How I would help the Uconn facilities management

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT)
Interview Descriptions: There are a multitude of questions that deal with conflict resolution, moorality and problem solving. You will be interviewed by a hall director and they are all friendly or  personable.
Interview Questions: What is a time you had to stand up for someone?

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Interview was not bad at all. Mostly interpersonal questions off of a script that were all easy to answer. Nothing too complicated and they do not expect you to have unlimited experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about something you're passionate about.

title: Assistant Professor, Academic Affairs Division Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Farmington, CT) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was four months total. As a final candidate undergoing four interviews with 29 individuals was told that the job search was a fail for the employer due to not specifying credentials correctly on front end (needed MD vs. PhD or EdD) for position.
Interview Questions: One of the many questions they asked me was what type of experience did I have teaching MDs in the community who oversee internships

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: interviewed by everyone on the administrative team (3 people). They emailed me asking what times I was available, and scheduled the interview based on that. They asked common interview questions and I had a chance to ask my own questions at the end.
Interview Questions: strengths and weaknesses?, why do you want this position?, do you work well in a team? ask questions at the end, shows you are prepared. also bring a copy of your schedule

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: I was flown to the university to meet the students and faculty. I had five 15 minute interviews with different faculty members. The interview was low-stress and was mainly used to verify that potential students don't show any red flags.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about some of the research you've done?
What would you like to research if you came here?

title: Student Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Hartford, CT)
Interview Descriptions: 2 Phone interviews with recruiter  1 In person interview with the hiring manager/ supervisor  A callback if you're chosen to discuss position, expectations and salary/ pay. In contact with HR to continue process and training
Interview Questions: They walk you through your resume and ask if you know specific softwares

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: A series of interviews usually 3, before offer is extended to you. The process is pretty straight forward but you gotta think of the responses beforehand. The panelists I interviewed with were very friendly and made me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with director of department I was doing research in at UConn Health. Very low-key, we went over my courses and technical background (since this was my first research internship)
Interview Questions: How well do you work with a team?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions:
There was no interview , I applied online, submitted my cv, publications and expression of interest form. I had to take the Toefl exam and the GRE as well
After completing my application I got an email a week later stating that I was selected and that I would receive a formal offer in a week
Interview Questions: N/A

title: ITS Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Technical questions, behavioral questions, and a variety of other questions. Very typical interview. You should generally know how to do most basic technical troubleshooting. Not much is needed beyond that.
Interview Questions: How would you remove a virus?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Hartford, CT) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: 1st round is telephonic to discuss Amazon's principles question, there could be SQL and Excel questions too in the interview. Be prepared with situations and star approach for all these questions
Interview Questions: Behavioral Questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: One brief interview with a manager and another program staff. They asked the usual questions asked during interviews. Then, they explained some of the job responsibilities, work hours, challenges, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work experience and how it has prepared you for this X position?

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: It was very comfortable, people were inviting, very casual interview, great place to work and fortunate to be able to work here I really enjoy the atmosphere and over all quality of the place
Interview Questions: Describe yourself

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was fast-paced with a couple of rounds.  They asked me to explain about my projects and working experience. When will I be able to start? More questions were on my resume.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
It was fairly simple they asked about me and my past work experience, what languages I knew and if I would be willing to continue next semester too.
Also they asked me if I was on work study or student labor
Interview Questions: How many hours can you work?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviews over the course of ten months. Mix of virtual and in person with multiple members of the team / associated departments. Overall very straight forward and easy
Interview Questions: How do you keep up to date with career trends?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT)
Interview Descriptions: This depends almost entirely on the particular lab you'd like to join, though I haven't heard of anyone having a particularly strenuous interview. It's easiest to just find a professors office hours and talk to them then.
Interview Questions: Asked about previous projects, classes I'd taken, what my career interests were.

title: Ding Hall Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick and easy. You are asked questions about your temperament, prior work experience, and availability. It should take no longer than 10 minutes. The majority of people will get hired with no trouble. After you have been offered the position, you choose which shifts you want to work.
Interview Questions: Have you had any prior work experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Waterbury, CT) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interviewees were very pleasant. Although there was a panel of three individuals, the interview was not intimidating. They asked a series of moderately easy and standard interview questions from a sheet of paper.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy, just asking you general questions about other roles you've been in. There is a list of questions and you basically just go through each one and they give you the list of questions at the interview which is helpful.
Interview Questions: How do you handle and interact with diversity?

title: International Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The staff member asked a lot of behavioral questions and also about previous student leader roles in the community. Also asked about how to deal with emergency during international student orientation.
Interview Questions: Have you ever deal with conflict situation and how did you manage it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standard process. Apply online or in person. If your a student, I recommend applying in person and introducing yourself. If it’s a match, a 30 minute interview with the director of the department will follow within 1-2weeks. Offer letter
Interview Questions: What are you interest in your degree.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: It involved a big interview day where many candidates were sit in a hot seat to be interviewed by one hall director and current resident assistant. The interview took a total of about 30 minutes and they offered time to ask them questions as well.
Interview Questions: Name a time you came across a difficult situation and how did you handle it.

title: Transportation Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and simple. The hiring manager was personable and did not make me feel intimidated. Everyone in the department was extremely friendly and helpful, they created a great path for me to follow.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy; I was referred to the writing center by a professor and answered questions regarding previous tutoring experience and tutoring strategies. After the interview,  applicants read material about tutoring and applied it in person
Interview Questions: Do you have any tutoring experience?

title: Clerk Typist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Basically they only email you to say some one else was given the job even though I have more then the qualifications.  There is nothing else to say.  No Interview was given! I was literally over qualified for the job with my skills and expertise. It's not a good way to do business applying online and no one to contact or get return phone call.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and a cover letter that included the questions the school asked, and got a email with interview details. Not everyone was asked for an interview. The questions were more about yourself than situational questions.
Interview Questions: How do you organize your schedule

title: Residental Cousnelor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Two round interview
Very general questions but they look for people with positive energy
Interviews can be conducted with a Hall Director (sometimes with another RA)
You'll hear back about a month or less after the interview process.
Interview Questions: What is something about you that could get in the way of you completing your job as described?

title: Husky Ambassador Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT)
Interview Descriptions: Met one on one with supervisor in her office. Intense and specific questions, especially about commitment and how much time you have to give to the program, even outside of normal work days/hours
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Awarded based on status within the program.  Typically a desirable student will get some sort of Graduate Assistantship. It is possible for students in the program to get an Assistantship once they prove their value, but do not count on this. It is best to go meet with the department, your potential advisor, and to write your materials reflecting potential strengths you would bring to your assistantship.
Interview Questions: How well do you speak English?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Super simple, if you get an interview you most likely will get the job. Just stay calm, dress appropriate and you will be fine. It is mainly a phone job so speak clearly and concise.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Uconn Foundation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online, had a phone interview with HR, first round on-campus interview  with two groups of 5+ coworkers, then final round on campus with a director and AVP as well as a written assessment the process took 3+ months
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phone to schedule a phone interview.  They asked four questions.  I was then invited for a campus interview where I was interviewed by a search committee of four people, a director and had a campus tour led by a student.  The search committee was friendly and the student was pleasant and knowledgeable.
Interview Questions: The typical questions about work experience.  But there was one personal question that I keep replaying in my mind, which was the director asked me if I had children and their ages.

title: Student Advisor for Study Abroad Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: I was first called for a phone interview and then called in to interview. The interview was long and I had to prepare a presentation. I met all the higher ups and they took me to lunch. After the interview my references had told me they were contacted. I had a really good feeling. I waited weeks and finally reached out to their administrator and shortly after received a copy and pasted emails stating they went with someone else. The experience was great until then.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best candidate for the position?

title: Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: 15-30 minute meeting with various interview questions aimed to show how candidate would handle certain situtations in a management role. Example: how would you mediate conflict between other student workers?
Interview Questions: How would you mediate conflict between other student workers?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was brought into the office and went over the talking points on the resume. Why this department and the strengths and weaknesses. Pretty standard process overall.  All interviewers were professional and very conversational.
Interview Questions: Why this department in particular?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job through a professor and got contacted immediately. There are only two openings per semester. It is easy if you know the professor. Micheal Y. is your best person to go to for an internship at the library.
Interview Questions: I didn't get asked.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with University consultant working for its NGO partner. Base on your experience and most are behavior questions. Talked my past experience and go through the resume details. It preferred candidate had first hand knowledge to work with small business owners
Interview Questions: Why you want to work for UConn.

title: Telecom Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Farmington, CT) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: My interview was very relaxed and informative.!I felt as if I stood my ground on the questions they ask.. I gave positive feedback on my experience in the medical field and my interaction with patients and co-workers...
Interview Questions: How am I in regards to dealing with irritable patients?  How can I resolve their issue without blaming others for not being helpful to them.

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: The Interviewers just asked questions to learn more about myself, as well as situational/behavioral questions. The interview took no more than 30-45 minutes. They were very friendly and welcoming.
Interview Questions: What is one weakness?

title: Student Laborer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Farmington, CT) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is easy, you have to know about the company and the role as questions about both will be asked.  They will address your eduction and your extracurricular activities. The role address patient care so expect questions related on how to deal with a situation and not let it get out of hand.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your weakness.

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Groton, CT) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email after a month. Interview was simple, describing yourself and explain some basic computer questions to show that you can fix or help with simple errors that may occur around the campus
Interview Questions: Tell me a weakness of yours

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very well conducted, and thought out . first there was a telephone screening interview and then an in person one. There was a panel conditioning of  seraph panel consisting of people that did not work directly in the department but had daily interaction with the department
Interview Questions: why was I applying for that job

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Several online interviews spaced widely apart, including teaching a class from a distance and developing sample online course materials.   
Each time I was told I would hear back from them soon, then weeks would go past with no information.  I assumed I was no longer being considered only to receive a message that there was another hoop to jump through.

Actual interviews were very short with little time left for my questions and little interaction with the interview committee.
Interview Questions: The only unusual request was to create content for an existing class.

title: Director IT Security Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Farmington, CT) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with the acting CIO, IT Ops Director, Privacy and Compliance Lead and Legal Lead. Panel was forthcoming about the work environment and challenges. Had ample opportunity to ask pointed questions. UCONN did not bother to notify that I was not selected as a viable candidate, no,further communication after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UCONN Health and Medical?

title: Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was over the phone and I was asked basic questions about my previous experience and cover letter. Was called back for a second round and it was an in person 1:1 interview where we went over position details more in depth.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had a casual meeting with my future PI. expressed my interest in his research and the job, then had small talk about the field and future directions of the research he was performing in the lab.
Interview Questions: Can you do X,Y and Z? How would you approach this problem?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Three people on the interview committee and approximately 10-12 interview questions. There is a first and second interview. One week to hear back in between interviews, two weeks from last interview and decision made.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this position?

title: Package Handler Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions:
I attended a sort observation at the distribution center, which was required before I could fill out the online application. A recruiter led me on a tour of the place and then suggested applying there and having an interview immediately. I filled out the application and proceeded to the interview. It all took less than two hours.

From the day of the interview to the job offer was four business days, and I started work on Monday the next week.
Interview Questions: Can you do this job?

title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Took 45 minutes and involved two of the managers sitting down and asking you questions. Was really a comfortable setting and they really just wanted to see how you are and how you would deal with situations.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths and weaknesses?

title: IT Help Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on jobx. Was looking for a student job. Was interviewed by 3 staff members all at once. Had 1 phone interview and had 1 in person interview. Overall a great experience.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to format multiple computers all at once?

title: Student Worker At Putnam Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs Mansfield, CT) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the online portal. After analyzing my resume, got a mail from Putnam Dining Service for a small chat. Student manager showed me the shifts available. Minimum criteria is 10 working hours/week
Interview Questions: Working hours and flexibility

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I got invited for the interview based on referral from a faculty member of the school for the position of Departmental IT Help in one of the departments in the School of Engineering.

The interview is just a chat of basic knowledge of  Computer Support and the funding opportunities available up to dissertation credits . 
Afterwards, necessary paper works were conducted and appointment commenced.
Interview Questions: One of those mentions  is on Window OS Imaging

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Straight to the point.  Accommodating. Made an appointment with the professor of my choice.  He told me what he would have me do as a studio apprentice.  I was willing to do anything to further my knowledge of printmaking.
Interview Questions: What would you like to learn?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
went through the resume and asked about the skills and expertise.
Asked about the previous experiences, hobbies, likes and dislikes.
few leadership questions on handling situations.
when can i start?
what am i expecting from the job?
Interview Questions: what is a project?

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Farmington, CT) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was referred to the PI by another employee at the institution. After exchanging emails, submitting resume and letter of recommendation, I interviewed with the PI directly at his lab. Sat down and talked about the various projects that he's working on and what I might be helping out with once I join the lab. In my case the PI himself basically hired me
Interview Questions: what was your previous research experience?

title: Assistant Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: They asked a lot of questions. What if's mostly. They wanted to know how I would handle players if they got out of hand, what would I do, what would I say, etc.. They also asked why I should be chosen to be a manager, what sets me apart from other people, what skills do I bring to the table.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a player was swearing and being unreasonable?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: asked questions about certain scenarios (roommate issues, alcohol, breaking room inspections). they want to hear that you are all about being inclusive, and fostering an educational environment for self growth.
Interview Questions: roommate issues

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Hartford, CT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: For an hour, knowing my past research experience and future goals. How I would like to contribute in the team and can help achieve the current projects. I was shown around in the department and introduced to coworkers.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to join UConn?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with PI and other lab members. Sometimes they call you on campus for the lab tour. Multiple email conversations with lab members later on. I actually had 3 skype interviews with my PI.
Interview Questions: Background

title: Graduate Teaching Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: You apply online using your transcript , GRE score and Physics GRE score. The admission committe wil review your application and based on the research interest and academic qualification they will make you an offer.
Interview Questions: No questions asekd.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Presentation to the research group, and then followed by one-on-one Interview with relevant faculty and this is followed up with the HR. Additionally, introduced to potential peers and the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Career goals

title: Legal Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Farmington, CT)
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Office of Diversity and Equity's supervisor and we discussed the position of a legal intern.  He detailed the position, and asked me questions pertaining to my interest in employment discrimination.  The interview lasted roughly thirty minutes, and I was introduced to other employees that I would work with and the office itself.
Interview Questions: What inspired my interest in Employment law?

title: Recreation Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT)
Interview Descriptions: Meet with a manager and Coordinator of Operations to answer questions pertaining to work ethic. Asked basic questions on facilities management, what you would do in different situations, and if you have the customer service skills to work in the environment.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: I was selected overseas and there was no interview. My background matches what a faculty at ECE and then I was chosen to work for him as a research assistant.
Interview Questions: no interview was taken.

title: Student Union A/V Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended by a friend and applied online. They called me in same-day. After the first interview they called me same-day for another interview a week later. interviews were in a panel with the manager and 4-5 techs. Was all behavioral questions. Important topics seemed to be availability, customer service experience, and personality.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a customer service experience that didn't go well.

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not very difficult.  There was an emphasis on work ethic and flexibility and how you could contribute to the overall work environment. There was nothing tricky about it; you just had to display your eagerness to work and positive attitude.
Interview Questions: Name three words you would use to describe yourself.

title: Creative Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (New Haven, CT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Presented creative capabilities to enthusiastic reception. Discuss work methodology and how this would apply to client needs. Present qualifications of different members of the team.
Discuss background of the Health Center and positive contributions to the community.
Interview Questions:
Can you make presentations with comprehensive materials ?
When can you plan to present recommendations ?

title: Program Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job online and was contacted about a month later to set up a phone interview. The phone interview was a conference call with four people which was slightly awkward because of the number of the people on the call. The interview didn't flow like a regular in person interview. The position was never filled due to budget concerns.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard interview questions.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed from university job posting website (JobX) and asked to interview with Hall Director. After being hired, I was asked to provide my school schedule as well as schedules of extracurriculars. Went in for my assigned hours and needed to find replacement for when I needed time off.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths/weaknesses?

title: Student Employee - Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs Mansfield, CT) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with my adviser, asked a few personal questions before going over my responsibilities and obligations. Could definitely tell that they care about who you are and your values as it is a copany related to the excellence of the University.
Interview Questions: What is your relationship like with your parents?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Hartford, CT) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very open and simple, asked in to meet with the office and go over my experience, goals, and what the position would offer. Was able to meet with the full team that worked in the office, all very friendly people.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Farmington, CT) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview committee made me feel very comfortable. They explained the details and requirements of the job and I impressed upon them why I was best fit to perform the job duties.
Interview Questions: Why did I think I was best fit for the job

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs Mansfield, CT) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy, better if you know the professor. If interested just go up and ask one of your professors they normally have room. There isn't even really a real interview process.
Interview Questions: Q: What do you want to do in the future?

title: Transportation Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Manchester, CT) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was in depth including the necessary requirements that i will need to get to continue with the job.  The process of getting a CDL and their training process.  Also the minimum hours I will have to work every week.
Interview Questions: Can you drive long periods of time and maintain focus/ critically think?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the professor. Asked the questions related to my Masters and my motivation for the degree. Professor seemed satisfied and told me he will let me know the updated within a week. Got the offer after 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: What did you during your Masters?

title: Student Shoveler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Brief group interview/informational session. Job duties, salary, and hours were explained and we were given a brief period to ask any questions we had. The job was essentially anyone's who wanted it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Send email if you have a position, right after 1 day, he asked me to visit his lab. After 1 week I have onsite interview with two professors. It takes about 1 hour, and get a offer.
Interview Questions: what did you do for your previous job

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: short but rough and tough, they ask many many questions, they are looking for the best match in sense of research interests with the advisor, because at engineering you need to apply for grant to get funding for the research and the program
Interview Questions: back ground question were not expected

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied ECE department at the University of Connecticut. After few weeks a faculty called me and set up for an interview. I gave the interview and told me I will be accepted as a Research Assistant. I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: Please tell me your research experience in this field

title: Violence Against Women Prevention Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: It was a long interview process. After having two in phone interviews I went to Uconn for an entire day and interviewed with over 20 people. There were about five separate "meetings" I had throughout the day but really they were just interviews with new people. I had both breakfast and lunch with directors of programs and gave an hour long presentation.
Interview Questions: The whole day was long and in each interview I was asked basically the same questions. I felt like I was repeating myself the whole day. I also felt like I was forced to perform for people.

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an online application on the student employment website and submitted a resume through the same system.  I went in for an interview and was offered the job through email later that day.
Interview Questions: There were no particularly challenging questions.  They were all run-of-the-mill.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Overall, this was a very very easy process. I applied online, and didn't hear back for a month. When I came for the interview, it was with a panel. They asked many diverse questions, about an hour long in total. The offer came 1 week later.
Interview Questions: How does your experience prepare you for the roles and responsibilities of this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Its pretty easy, ur background and work experience. not much difficult technical interview, just few relevent Qs, plus the interviewers are very friendly and very experienced, so better say no to a question rather than lying or giving wrong answers
Interview Questions: They can ask you applications of ur past work in their work. so better know your past experience work tech details.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs Mansfield, CT) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Talk to the advisor. If you are interested in his/her work and there is some fund, you are good to go. Normally you will get back from them in a timely manner, as long as he/she is not at sabbatical leave.
Interview Questions: Describe your research interest.

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not demanding, as it was a student position.  The supervisor asked if I was able to commit to a set schedule.  They also made sure that I knew I was representing the university.
Interview Questions: Are you able to commit to a set schedule?

title: UCP Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Follow the directions on job posting and be sure to state on the resume and cover letter how you meet the minimum qualifications
Interview Questions: Why work at UConn?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: depending on your cv and cover letter and whether someone from the department LOOOOOVE you for unsure reasons (definitely not because you are the best among applicants).
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview is hosted by a professor of program staff of business analytics and project management. Dont be nerviness just take a breathe and take it easy. He will ask something about SQL and SAS, so be prepared for your resume and your project did before.
Interview Questions: do you know about SQL or SAS

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT)
Interview Descriptions:
Graduate Students are selected by Faculty based GRE, TOEFL scores.
Projects, Internships, Prior Job experiences, skill-set requirements for current projects are all criterion's which professors look at before hiring.
Interview Questions: Depends on the individual.

title: Financial Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Set up interview over the phone and when you get there be prepared that they have search committees (mine was five people), it's not one-on-one. 

Typically from the time you apply it does take a long time to hear back from them, and the hiring process takes a long time as well because everything they do needs HR approval.
Interview Questions: Have you looked at our website/do you know what we do?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: This is largely based on the specific department. I was interviewed once and hired weeks later.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process just has you go over your basic work ethic and hours desired like any other job. Nothing extensive. Be prepared for questions primarily focused around your physical skills and not so much anything on food preparation or cleanliness
Interview Questions: What hours can you work? Will you work weekends? Can you lift heavy materials and stand on your feet for long durations of time?

title: Investment Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and professional, common interview questions.
Interview Questions: What does investment mean to you?

title: UConn Learning Center (QCenter) Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two ~30 minute long tests focusing on Calc I and II concepts. Initial test was somewhat simpler - after passing of this test, the second was taken under supervision by GA. However, my experience was influenced by referral from previous employer (where I also acted as a tutor for mathematics).
Interview Questions: What is the limit of sum((4n^2 - n) / (n^3 - 9)) as n goes from 1 to inf.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: I convinced a professor for PhD admission. I submitted my CV and statement of purpose. After his approval, I applied for admission.
Interview Questions: I faced no difficulty.

title: Academic Advisor I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The first round of interviews was over the phone. There was a panel of people with whom I spoke - I think it had 4 or 5 people (which I think is a little much for a phone interview). A few days after the phone interview I was invited to campus, where I met with a large panel and then had several individual interviews. It didn't take very long for me to hear back after coming to campus. I negotiated a salary and start date and they were very accommodating.
Interview Questions: The asked how I would handle faculty members who were resistant to the idea of serving as faculty academic advisors.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and contact with potential advisor
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Contact the lab PI before the application. Both of us from the same university. He is new PI I'll be the first Ph.D. student. Then application through the school.
Interview Questions: not too much

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Was hired out of graduate school.
Interview Questions: Already had a good teaching history with the school so interview was minimal.

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Nothing too exciting, standard behavioral interview. The questions consisted mostly of your background and ability to do the job. The managers interviewing are often not the ones you will work with, thus the emphasis is on likability during the review. What happens after is usually someone else's problem to deal with, making the interview process very relaxed and easy.
Interview Questions: What other jobs have you previously done that involve managing others?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the position on the University Careers website.  I didn't hear anything back from them for a few weeks which was concerning, but they eventually contacted me for a phone interview.

The phone interview was scheduled for a week later and was with 5 individuals.  They started off by introducing themselves.  Next, I was asked a series of situational questions relating to how I would handle different problems.  The main goal of these questions was to evaluate my critical thinking and problem solving skills.  I think they also wanted to have an understanding of my knowledges of different web based/database technologies. After about 1.5 hours, the phone interview was complete and they said they would be in touch either way.

Two days after the phone interview, I received a an email asking me to come in for an on-site interview in which I would provide an example of an advanced web application that I had developed.  The next week I had the onsite interview with the same 5 people from the phone interview.  It was a pretty welcoming interview compared to others that I've had.  It was only 45 minutes long and primarily consisted of me demonstrating my application and discussing the design and implementation of the application.

A week after the on-site interview I received an offer letter and accepted
Interview Questions: What is your favorite programming language?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs Mansfield, CT) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Ask about interests in community building.
Interview Questions: Who is someone you admire or is a hero to you?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Three step screening process. Initial information, followed by a prompt followed by an interview. Main focus on diversity and priorities. The inital information was mostly just basic things such as GPA, prior  involvement within the university etc. The prompt was based on what I would do in a given situation as an RA. Basically they want to see that you know to prioritize the job over things like going to a party. The interview was pretty much your run-of-the-mill kind of questions.
Interview Questions: Why is diversity important to a college campus?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was on a Skype call. I was asked about the skills, interests and academic credentials. Interviewer was the professor. Professor shared information about the upcoming project project. The interview lasted for 30 minutes or so and it that was the only single step.
Interview Questions: Interest and skills

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: Submit the application on line, with GRE, TOFEL scores, recommendation letter, CV and so on. Then after two months comes the telephone interview. Then after two weeks comes the email offer. Mailed offer letter came 3 weeks later than email offer. There is not much technical questions in phone interview. It's like normal chatting, just want to know your personality.
Interview Questions: What's your most proud accomplishment until now?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut
Interview Descriptions: I communicated with a professor via my friend. Professor liked my CV and asked to apply. I had to submit a statement of purpose. There was no interview. My supervisor is really kind enough. He helped me to get the admission and funding.
Interview Questions: There was no interview.

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with Dean of Students and fellow managers, was referred to by a coworker in another department. After meeting, I was screened and accepted the position in the Department of Psychology and the Department of Engineering.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to our work team?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (New York, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It's pretty typical as other applications. Prepare the required materials and mail everything to the assistant. One phone interview from a faculty in the department. Got an offer via email.
Interview Questions: questions related to research and experience on resume

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the professor via email and he set up the interview time. I emailed him my transcript and CV. During the interview he asked me about what I have written in CV.
Interview Questions:
Describe what you did in the project.
Have you read my paper?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Had a meeting with the researchers in the group. Gave a presentation of my research work to the department staff and faculty. Interview ended with lunch with the hiring professor.
Interview Questions: My dissertation work

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (New York, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process was very simple.  I applied online and was e-mailed not too long after that.  I met with the director of the school I would work for within the university.  I was introduced to staff and got to communicate with them and ask them questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying to this position?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: One in person interview with two full time staff at the place where we would be working. Very informal, kept it more like a conversation, got to know me better, I found out later that week that I got the job. I applied online and then got a phone call to schedule an in person interview the next week. I was also given a tour of the office and was informed on the duties. I was not told how many people they were hiring or how many were interviewing though. It was an overall good experience. Dress business professional. Bring your resume.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses and strengthes, how do you handle time management

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs Mansfield, CT) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and casual. More focused on personality than credentials. so brief it did not feel like an interview. I was left waiting for a few minutes and felt sort of confused.
Interview Questions: What relevant experience have you had?

title: Biology Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Mansfield Center, CT) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: They ask us to make an appoint for interview with phone call. Generally asking me abouth what he has interest in their field. Most important thing is to have similar research experience to their current research project.
Interview Questions: how logn do you study this field ?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: We communicated via e-mail to set up an interview date. The interview seemed to be fairly informal, around 15 minutes or so. They asked to see my work and talked to me about my courses and schoolwork.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a stressful situation?

title: Strategic Sourcing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It will be months before people are called for an interview.  Typically, a preliminary phone interview of all qualified applicants, and then top 3-4 for in-person second round interviews.  Committee styled second round interviews with structured questions, but the interviewers aren't hiring managers and no one from HR is included.
Interview Questions: Asked what was the least effective aspect of my former supervisor's management style

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: contacted prof through various emails and send my resume. I had a phone screen and skype interview. I got selected in the interview and i was contacted by university afterwards
Interview Questions: where are you working currently

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Farmington, CT) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three day interview process: dinner with current students and faculty a night before and full-day interview the next day with three different faculty members, each lasting 30 minutes. The last day starts with a poster session with current students, ending with lunch and a short field trip to a local museum.
Interview Questions: What would you want to achieve as a scientist?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The job interview process can be lengthy. Being interviewed once and getting a job offer is typically a thing of the past. Today, many companies have an involved interview process starting with screening interviews, followed by in-person interviews, second interviews and even third interviews.
Interview Questions: Q: what is your research interests

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had classes with the professor in Undergrad so there was not really an interview, I just needed to get accepted to the graduate school in uconn. When researching in the lab, my professor had funding and I was placed on an industry project.
Interview Questions: The only question was maybe, what is your GPA?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Emailed my resume and was asked to go to campus for an interview. Since I had to go for orientation it was not a huge deal. Went in to the Electrical and Computer Engineering offices and was given a very laid back interview by their wonderful business manager.
Interview Questions: What administrative work have you done in the past?

title: Field Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Responded to an add on the jobs website. Was interview over the phone. No technical questions just asked about experience and training.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work as a field supervisor?

title: Educational Psychology Doctoral Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs Mansfield, CT) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a pleasant experience - not too intimidating. A 40 minute presentation on the work I'd done so far in my previous Masters program in Statistics followed by fee question and answers. Later I had individual meetings with faculty members which comprised mainly of discussing interests, future goals and so on. Lastly, I also had the opportunity to spend time with the current graduate student body which also helped me learn immensely about the dynamics of the graduate student life in this particular program.
Interview Questions: Why are you switching programs?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Online application through the university's student employment website. Interview performed over the phone or on campus depending upon the student's preference. Interview was very informal, discussing more of the department's role, and personal work history. The interview lasted about 20 minutes, and only about 2 questions were asked of myself.
Interview Questions: After discussing how they are a complicated operation that will require time to learn, they discussed how they are interested in hiring students for multiple years. They then asked: "Are you looking to be employed for multiple years? Does this security seem something of interest to you?"

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: there will be a phone interview first. Professors will ask questions about your academic background and research experience if any. Also you will be asked about the research interest, your academic plan and some behavior questions
Interview Questions: What is your particular research interest?

title: Shuttle Driver/Preventative Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Connecticut in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Once you submit your application, you are asked to come in for an interview.  The interview is fairly standard and they basically accept anyone who has a clean driving record and is a junior or younger at the University.
Interview Questions: What situation at a different employer have you resolved that you think will positively influence your time here?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was not a very formal interview. The person hiring just had few questions. They would initially give opportunity to everybody and would analyse their performance before continuing their contract.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs Mansfield, CT) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I first applied for this job online through the University of Connecticut's student job postings website. After uploading my resume and filling out a short form, I was sent an email asking me to come to the departmental office for an in-person interview. At the interview, I was asked about my related skills and given an idea of what needed to be done. After being given the main task, I was asked if I would like to work there. I accepted, and now I am currently a part-time student worker there.
Interview Questions: What do you know about PHP?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Storrs, CT) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview Details – Applied online and gave a video interview. Questions at glassdoor. Gave a technical interview few weeks later. Most of the questions are from glassdoor, could not answer 2-3 correctly maybe. I guess if you can not solve a problem you can ask the interviewer for hints and if you are wrong he tries to make you reconsider your answer. After the interview the interviewer asked me to ask questions about the position. Said he will forward my result and I will be hear from them in 2 weeks if they are interested. Checked application status after 10 minutes and found out that I was rejected.
Interview Questions:
2. Relationship between determinant of inverse of a matrix and its determinant.

3. If there are 400 people in room, what is the probability that at least 2 people share the same birthday?

4. Impulse to a linear discrete system, x[n] = [1 2 3 5 10]. Input signal frequency = 100Hz, what is the output frequency?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Connecticut (Hartford, CT) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Send emails and ask some academic questions regarding to my background. Then telephone interview for more detail question in terms of what kind of project I have been involved and what my role in it.
Interview Questions: What's most difficult problems I have met and how I solved it.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a typical application process.  My department afforded most entering students a TA-ship.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
